Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved positioning the drainage cannula tip into the superior vena cava (SVC) and crossing the reinfusion cannula in the right atrium (RA).

Objective.evidence: This study explores the potential of the F(SVC)–J(RA) configuration in veno-venous extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (V–V ECMO) to enhance systemic oxygenation in patients with severe respiratory failure.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the partial pressure of arterial oxygen (PaO2), monitored throughout the ECMO treatment.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The patient exhibited a PaO2 exceeding 200 mmHg, even with minimal ventilation under lung rest conditions.
